expert.name: David Sinclair
expert.bio: Harvard professor and geneticist known for research on aging, sirtuins, and NAD+. Author of 'Lifespan: Why We Age and Why We Don't Have To'.

supplements.name: NMN (Nicotinamide Mononucleotide)
supplements.description: NAD+ precursor that restores cellular NAD+ levels, supporting sirtuins and cellular energy

supplements.name: Resveratrol
supplements.description: Polyphenol from grapes that activates sirtuins and mimics caloric restriction benefits

supplements.name: Metformin
supplements.description: Diabetes drug with longevity benefits through AMPK activation (prescription required)

supplements.name: Quercetin
supplements.description: Flavonoid with senolytic properties that helps clear senescent cells

supplements.name: Fisetin
supplements.description: Flavonoid with potent senolytic activity, clearing damaged cells

supplements.name: Spermidine
supplements.description: Polyamine that induces autophagy and cellular renewal

supplements.name: Alpha Lipoic Acid
supplements.description: Antioxidant that regenerates other antioxidants and supports mitochondrial function

supplements.name: Coenzyme Q10 (CoQ10)
supplements.description: Essential for mitochondrial energy production, declines with age

supplements.name: Omega-3 (EPA/DHA)
supplements.description: Essential fatty acids supporting brain health and reducing inflammation

supplements.name: Vitamin D3
supplements.description: Hormone-like vitamin essential for immune function and longevity

supplements.name: Vitamin K2
supplements.description: Works with D3 to direct calcium properly and protect cardiovascular system

supplements.name: TMG (Trimethylglycine)
supplements.description: Methyl donor that supports methylation when taking NMN/NR

interventions.name: Intermittent Fasting
interventions.description: Skip one meal per day or practice 16:8 fasting to activate sirtuins and autophagy

interventions.name: Cold Exposure
interventions.description: Brief cold exposure to activate brown fat and stress response pathways

interventions.name: Exercise (Vigorous)
interventions.description: High-intensity exercise activates AMPK and sirtuins, mimicking caloric restriction

interventions.name: Heat Exposure (Sauna)
interventions.description: Sauna use induces heat shock proteins and provides cardiovascular benefits

interventions.name: Hypoxia Training
interventions.description: Brief periods of reduced oxygen (altitude training, breath holds) activates HIF pathway

protocols.name: Sinclair Longevity Stack
protocols.description: David Sinclair's personal supplement protocol targeting NAD+, sirtuins, and aging pathways. Core longevity interventions.

supplements.name: NMN (Nicotinamide Mononucleotide)
supplements.rationale: Restores NAD+ levels which decline 50% by middle age

supplements.name: Resveratrol
supplements.rationale: Sirtuin activator, take with fat for absorption (e.g., olive oil, yogurt)

supplements.name: TMG (Trimethylglycine)
supplements.rationale: Methyl donor to offset NMN's methylation demands

protocols.name: NAD+ Restoration Protocol
protocols.description: Focused protocol for restoring NAD+ levels through NMN and supporting compounds.

protocols.name: Senolytic Protocol
protocols.description: Periodic senolytic protocol to clear senescent cells. Not for daily use - typically done as intermittent course.

supplements.name: Quercetin
supplements.rationale: Senolytic activity, take for 2-3 consecutive days monthly

protocols.name: Sinclair Fasting Protocol
protocols.description: Intermittent fasting approach to activate longevity pathways without extreme restriction.

interventions.name: Intermittent Fasting
interventions.rationale: Activates sirtuins and autophagy through metabolic switching

protocols.name: Sinclair Exercise Protocol
protocols.description: Exercise as a longevity intervention through AMPK and sirtuin activation.

interventions.name: Exercise (Vigorous)
interventions.rationale: HIIT or vigorous exercise mimics caloric restriction pathways

interventions.name: Cold Exposure
interventions.rationale: Activates brown fat and stress response

protocols.name: Mitochondrial Support Protocol
protocols.description: Support mitochondrial function and energy production which declines with age.

nutrition_principles.guidance: Eat less often. Skip a meal when possible (typically breakfast). The hunger sensation indicates activation of longevity pathways.
Minimize sugar and refined carbohydrates. They spike insulin and accelerate aging through glycation and mTOR activation.
Emphasize plant-based foods rich in polyphenols. Eat the rainbow - colorful plants contain xenohormetic compounds.
Limit red meat consumption. Associated with increased mTOR activation and potentially accelerated aging.
Use extra virgin olive oil liberally. Contains oleic acid and polyphenols supporting longevity. Good fat source for resveratrol absorption.
Never smoke. Smoking accelerates epigenetic aging dramatically and damages nearly every organ system.
